metadata.title: CVE-2022-42928 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
Certain types of allocations were missing annotations that, if the Garbage Collector was in a specific state, could have lead to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 102.4, Firefox ESR < 102.4, and Firefox < 106.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42928` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs78 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1').
